item.title: Russian attack on Kharkiv kills two, Ukraine hits missile plant
item.content:encoded: Kharkiv regional administration head, Oleh Syniehubov, reported that 175 'combat clashes' were recorded.

item.title: India vs South Africa: T20 World Cup Super Eights – teams, start, lineups
item.content:encoded: Defending champions and co-hosts India face debut-title chasing South Africa in rematch of last T20 World Cup final.

item.title: Two soldiers killed during military operation in Pakistan’s northwest: Army
item.content:encoded: An explosive-laden motorcycle rammed vehicle in security forces convoy, military says.

item.title: Giant tortoises return to Galapagos island after 150 years
item.content:encoded: More than 150 giant tortoises have been reintroduced to Ecuador’s Floreana Island in the Galapagos.

item.title: Iran demands ‘evidence’ as Trump, UN experts highlight protest killings
item.content:encoded: UN experts said discrepancy between official figures and grassroots estimates is compounding the anguish of families.

item.title: Israel wants to execute Palestinians and the world will allow it
item.content:encoded: An execution bill is being pushed through the Knesset. International indifference paved its way for it.

item.title: India signs critical minerals deal with Brazil to curb dependance on China
item.content:encoded: Brazilian President Lula called the critical minerals and rare earths deal the 'core of the pioneering agreement'.

item.title: LIVE: Pakistan vs New Zealand – T20 World Cup Super Eights
item.content:encoded: Follow our live build-up, with toss and team news, ahead of our text commentary stream of the Super Eights opener.

item.title: Tottenham Hotspur vs Arsenal: Premier League – team news, start, lineups
item.content:encoded: Igor Tudor's first game in charge of Spurs is a north London derby against wobbling Premier League leaders Arsenal.

item.title: Venezuela grants amnesty to 379 political prisoners
item.content:encoded: The move is in line with a new law, giving hope to throngs of others imprisoned over alleged plots to oust the government.

item.title: World reacts as US top court limits Trump’s tariff powers
item.content:encoded: Some countries welcome the ruling, while others review trade deals and economic effect.

item.title: Farmers in Gaza risk Israeli bullets to bring their fields back to life
item.content:encoded: Gaza farmers face risks as Israeli buffer zones expand into their agricultural lands under heavy military control.

item.title: Videos show aftermath of deadly Israeli attacks in Lebanon
item.content:encoded: Israel’s military has carried out air attacks on eastern Lebanon’s Bekaa Valley and refugee camp Ein el-Hilweh.

item.title: Protesters shoot fireworks at Albania prime minister’s office
item.content:encoded: Police confronted protesters in Albania’s capital Tirana after demonstrators shot fireworks and threw petrol bombs.

item.title: Trump to make three-day visit to China next month, White House says
item.content:encoded: Three-day trip, at Beijing's invitation, comes more than eight years after Trump's first visit to China.

item.title: Clashes in Albania as protesters demand PM Rama resign
item.content:encoded: Violence breaks out near parliament as demonstrators demand accountability in a corruption investigation.

item.title: UK weighs removing ex-Prince Andrew from succession line amid Epstein probe
item.content:encoded: The report comes as police widen investigations into former prince, including questioning his close protection teams.

item.title: Where are the most endangered languages in the world?
item.content:encoded: February 21 is World Mother Language Day. Al Jazeera looks at the most spoken languages and which ones are endangered.

item.title: Brazil’s Lula says Maduro should face trial in Venezuela, not US
item.content:encoded: Brazil's President Lula says fate of Venezuelan president should be determined by the 'people of Venezuela'.

item.title: Gunmen on motorcycles kill at least 50 in northwest Nigeria: Report
item.content:encoded: Nigerian lawmaker reports ‘at least 50 people dead’ after attack as list of missing is still being compiled.

item.title: Trump, JD Vance vilify ‘lawless’ Supreme Court justices over tariff ruling
item.content:encoded: President Trump calls Supreme Court justices an 'embarrassment to their families' in 45-minute address to media.

item.title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,458
item.content:encoded: These are the key developments from day 1,458 of Russia's war on Ukraine.

item.title: US military says it attacked vessel in Pacific Ocean, killing three people
item.content:encoded: US military's Southern Command (SOUTHCOM) claimed the vessel was involved in drug trafficking, without providing proof.

item.title: US envoy suggests it would be ‘fine’ if Israel expands across Middle East
item.content:encoded: 'It would be fine if they took it all,' Mike Huckabee says when asked about expanding Israel from Nile to Euphrates.

item.title: Twelve Palestine Action activists granted bail
item.content:encoded: Bailed activists include four former hunger strikers: Teuta Hoxha, Kamran Ahmed, Qesser Zuhrah and Heba Muraisi.
